properties.media:imagetext:
1
July 24, 1949
Dear Family,
I think that my last letter covered this trip as far as Japan.
We are now
flying fron Karachi, Pakistan to Danaseus, Syria - an eight-hour,
non-stop jump
of over 2,000 miles.
Fron Japan we flew to Okinawa and Hongkong.
A short trip
to Canton, three trips to Manila and one back to Tokyo, then on to Bengrok where
I stayed four days.
That is a most interesting and pleasant place.
The temples
are magnificent and the people so courteous and friendly that it is refreshing.
Everyone seems so glad to see you and even the taxi drivers say "thank you" in
marked contrast with the sullen gas jockeys of Manhattan.
I saw all the Cabinet
Ministers and the Prime Minister.
Also had a private, for-ne-only tour through
the Royal Palace accompanied by an under Secretary who knew the whole history
and spoke perfect English.
The Emerald Buddhe temple is one of the great sights
of the world.
It and other temples are closed to the public now because the
Palace grounds were chosen by the leaders of the most recent "coups d'etat" as
the base of their military operations, and they do not propose to be thrown out
the way they got in.
You will remenber that the young king was mysteriously
murdered a few years ago.
His body was put in a big earthenware jar and there
it must remain until his younger brother returns fron Switzerlend.
The Y.B.
seems to prefer his safe, comfortable Tyrolean bonnet rather than the fourteen
carat dangerous hardware which was shot off the unhappy head of his late older
brother.
Apparently he has no intention of coming hone.
So,
the funeral pyre
on which the body of the late King will be cremated stands weathered and dila-
pidated outside the Palace grounds.
We have just flown over the Texas Company refinery on Behrein Island.
A
floating pipeline runs out to sea where five tankers were taking on oil.
beyond Behrein is enother great oil producing center - Dhahran, within sight
of which there are seven fields, each of which is larger than any other in the
world.
The Anglo-Irenian pipeline is being built (by Leif Sverdrup of St. Louis)
from here to Beirut.
It is just possible that while the Russian dog is barking
at Berlin, the Russian dog that doesn't bark - but may bite - is lurking silent
in this vast desert space below us.
At Menila I met a Sianese-Chinese named Chulind who gave me a Chinese
luncheon party at Bangkok followed by a pienie boatride on the river. It really
was a great treat.
The river traffic is much like Canton where people are born,
live and die on boats.
Te stopped at the Temple of the Dawn and climbed up
some stairs to ge a view of Bangkok.
I stayed at the Trocadero Hotel.
During my first night there my uneasy
sleep on a concrete mattress with pillow to match was broken by
the most terrific
yowling of dogs which were being killed in a cleanup empaign.
Fortunately they
got most of them the first night, because the din was not so bad on subsequent
You know, in British sphere countries they have three initial designations:
"H.E." which is "His Excellency", and when they get & little higher up on the
ATELLISIAOS
